item.title: SLOs for Open Source
item.description: Open source software has been used to build organizations for years. From libraries to complex infrastructure systems, the open source landscape provides a vast sea of solutions. For larger infrastructure projects, organizations are asking maintainers for service level objectives (SLOs). Many do not publish or provide any, even when projects come from organizations who likely had SLOs in place. In this post, I walk through my process for developing indicators and objectives for open source projects.
